com.d2c.util

Class SQLHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.d2c.util.SQLHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class SQLHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Contains tools and methods to interact with a database using JDBC

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SQLHandler()
      Creates a new SQLHandler connected to a MySQL database on localhost port 3306 with username "root" and password "password".

    • Constructor Detail

      • SQLHandler

        public SQLHandler()
           throws java.sql.SQLException,
                  java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Creates a new SQLHandler connected to a MySQL database on localhost port 3306 with username "root" and password "password".
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database access error occurs
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the driver class cannot be located

      • getAccountInfo

        public java.lang.Object[] getAccountInfo(java.lang.String user)
                                  throws EmptySetException,
                                         java.sql.SQLException
        Gets an account's information from the database using a user name input. Object[0] is the user name as a string, Object[1] is the password as a string, Object[2] is the first name of the account holder as a string, Object[3] is the last name of the account holder as a string, Object[4] is the date and time the account was created as a java.sql.Timestamp, Object[5] is the account's identifier in the database as an int.
        Parameters:
        user - the user name of the account to be retrieved
        Returns:
        an object array containing the data of the account searched
        Throws:
        EmptySetException - if the call to the database returns nothing
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database error occurs

      • makeAccount

        public void makeAccount(java.lang.String username,
                        java.lang.String password,
                        java.lang.String fname,
                        java.lang.String lname)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a new account on the database.
        Parameters:
        username - the account user name
        password - the account password
        fname - the first name of the account holder
        lname - the last name of the account holder
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a database error occurs

      • updateAccount

        public void updateAccount(java.lang.String username,
                          java.lang.String newPassword,
                          java.lang.String newFirstName,
                          java.lang.String newLastName)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Updates the information of a user on the database. Note: the user name cannot be updated or changed.
        Parameters:
        username - the user name of the account to be updated
        newPassword - the new password of the account
        newFirstName - the new first name on the account
        newLastName - the new last name on the account
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
